intro: Erigeron paposanus, commonly known as the Pahute Meadow Aster, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its showy blue to purple composite flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in open, sunny areas such as meadows and rocky slopes. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Erigeron paposanus plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological balance in its habitat.
